content.webTitle: The Arch View: Nine-hour TV buildup a first for Wigan

fields.headline: The Arch View: Nine-hour TV buildup a first for Wigan
fields.bodyText: MAN OF THE DAY Ben Watson. The understated, undervalued redhead broke his leg in November and scored the Cup final winner in May. Roy of the Rovers, and then some. RUNNER UP Dave Whelan broke his leg in the 1960 Cup final and owned the Cup winners in 2013. Took him a little longer to get his reward, but he got there in the end. PRECEDENT OF THE DAY ESPN's Cup final buildup running from 8am to 5.15pm. Never before has nine and a quarter hours of live preview been devoted to a Wigan match. ROW OF THE DAY Cost, timing, lack of trains and general contempt for fans made for plenty of empty seats at Wembley. All in the name of the FA protecting TV "content". SHOW OF THE DAY The contempt didn't end there. See the Budweiser Half-Time Show: two men playing an 80s-style video game against each other on big screens after winning a Bud Footy Facebook game. It didn't go down well. BEST SELF-PARODY Liam Gallagher: interviewed on ESPN pre-match, who had to bleep him three times. His verdict on the City's manager's future. "I'm all for Mancini, man." UNEXPECTED LINK OF THE DAY Mezzo soprano Victoria Gray, a member of the Cup final anthem-trilling operatic quartet Amore, is engaged to Sam Ogrizovic, nephew of Coventry's 1987 Cup-winning goalkeeper Steve. QUESTION OF THE DAY Will guard-of-honour specialists Arsenal now have to give Wigan one on Tuesday?
